definitions.definition: Working time outside of one's regular hours.
definitions.example: Workers are usually paid extra for working overtime.

definitions.definition: The rate of pay, usually higher, for work done outside of or in addition to regular hours.
An extra period of play when a contest has a tie score at the end of regulation. (British: extra time.)
definitions.example: That last-second shot ties the game 99-99 and sends it to overtime!

definitions.definition: To measure something incorrectly, as taking more time than it actually did.
Beyond the normal or usual extent.
